member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched
member.summary: ICameraStitched interface

member.name: E:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.OnStitchedImageGrabStarted
member.summary:
Event for grabbing stitched image has started from camera
Event orders :
OnStitchedImageGrabStarted
-> Repeat Rows * StitchCols times.
-->OnStitchedImageIndexBefore
--->OnStitchedImageIndexGrabbed
-->OnStitchedImageIndexAfter
-> Repeat end
OnStitchedImageGrabEnded
member.remarks: Arguments: ICamera, IProcess, object(for passing argument)

member.name: E:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.OnStitchedImageIndexBefore
member.summary:
Event for before grabbed stitched image at specific index from camera
Event orders :
OnStitchedImageGrabStarted
-> Repeat Rows * StitchCols times.
-->OnStitchedImageIndexBefore
--->OnStitchedImageIndexGrabbed
-->OnStitchedImageIndexAfter
-> Repeat end
OnStitchedImageGrabEnded
member.remarks: Arguments: ICamera, index, IProcess, object(for passing argument)

member.name: E:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.OnStitchedImageIndexGrabbed
member.summary:
Event for grabbed stitched image at specific index from camera
Event orders :
OnStitchedImageGrabStarted
-> Repeat Rows * StitchCols times.
-->OnStitchedImageIndexBefore
--->OnStitchedImageIndexGrabbed
-->OnStitchedImageIndexAfter
-> Repeat end
OnStitchedImageGrabEnded
member.remarks: Arguments: ICamera, index, Bitmap, IProcess, object(for passing argument)

member.name: E:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.OnStitchedImageIndexAfter
member.summary:
Event for after grabbed stitched image at specific index from camera
Event orders :
OnStitchedImageGrabStarted
-> Repeat Rows * StitchCols times.
-->OnStitchedImageIndexBefore
--->OnStitchedImageIndexGrabbed
-->OnStitchedImageIndexAfter
-> Repeat end
OnStitchedImageGrabEnded
member.remarks: Arguments: ICamera, index, IProcess, object(for passing argument)

member.name: E:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.OnStitchedImageGrabEnded
member.summary:
Event for grabbing stitched image has ended from camera
Event orders :
OnStitchedImageGrabStarted
-> Repeat Rows * StitchCols times.
-->OnStitchedImageIndexBefore
--->OnStitchedImageIndexGrabbed
-->OnStitchedImageIndexAfter
-> Repeat end
OnStitchedImageGrabEnded
member.remarks: Arguments: ICamera, IProcess, object(for passing argument)

member.summary: Event for stitched calibrator file has opened

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.StitchMarginWidth
member.summary:
Stitched x(or width) pixel margin for left and right
Cut-off x(or width) pixels at left and right edges.
----------------------------+-- | | Margin HEIGHT | . . . . . . . . . +-- | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . . . . . . . . + | | +-----+---------------+-----+ | | Margin WIDTH

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.StitchMarginHeight
member.summary:
Stitched y(or height) pixel margin for top and bottom
Cut-off y(or height) pixels at top and bottom edges.
----------------------------+-- | | Margin HEIGHT | . . . . . . . . . +-- | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . | | . . . . . . . . . + | | +-----+---------------+-----+ | | Margin WIDTH

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.StitchSingleFovPixel
member.summary:
FOV WxH size (pixel) for single stitched area
X = Width - StitchMarginWidth * 2
Y = Height - StitchMarginHeight * 2

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.StitchLargeFovPixel
member.summary:
FOV WxH size (pixel) for large stitched area
Width (pixel) = StitchSingleFovPixel * StitchCols
Height (pixel) = StitchSingleFovPixel * StitchRows

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.StitchSingleFovMm
member.summary:
FOV WxH size (mm) for single stitched area
Width (mm) = StitchSingleFovPixel * PixelSize (mm) / LensMagnification
Height (mm) = StitchSingleFovPixel * PixelSize (mm) / LensMagnification

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.StitchLargeFovMm
member.summary:
FOV WxH size (mm) for large stitched areas
Width (mm) = StitchSingleFovMm * StitchCols
Height (mm) = StitchSingleFovMm * StitchRows

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.StitchCalibrator
member.summary:
StitchCalibrator is used for calibration for each cells
Calibration process used for resolve optical distortion for grabbed image at each cells.
Used for each position at cells.
Do not set operation. Used by internally.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.CreateStitchedCells
member.summary:
Create stitched cells at StitchCalibrator
Assign ICamera.Rtc at before call

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.CtlStitchedGrab(System.Int32,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.IProcess,System.Object)
member.summary:
Grab(or acquire) stitched image at index from camera
Event OnProcessLightIntensity should be fired if process is assigned.
Event OnStitchedImageIndexBefore should be fired image at index before grabbed.
Event OnStichedImageGrabbed should be fired image at index has grabbed.
Event OnStitchedImageIndexAfter should be fired image at index after grabbed.
member.param:
Index no
Range from from 0 ~ StitchRows*StitchCols - 1

IProcess for inspect target.
If null, just do stitched grab only.
If not null, do LightIntensity, stitched grab and Inspect.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Camera.ICameraStitched.CtlStitchedGrab(SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.IProcess,System.Object)
member.summary:
Grab(or acquire) stitched whole images from camera
Event OnStichedImageGrabStarted should be fired when starting.
Event OnStichedImageGrabbed should be fired when every images at index are grabbed.
Event OnStichedImageGrabEnded should be fired when ended.
member.param:
IProcess for inspect target.
If null, just do stitched grabs only.
If not null, do LightIntensity, stitched grabs and Inspect.

---------------------------- | | | + Top y (mm) | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | +---------------+-- | 0 Right x (mm) | |

Move stage to top y(mm) position(at camera edge) and measure pattern x, y location by pixel.

Right x (mm)

Distance x, y (pixel) at right x position from origin
For example: measure pattern x, y location by pixel

Top y (mm)
For example: move stage to top y(mm) position(at camera edge) and find pattern

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.BarcodeResult.AIMDPM
member.summary:
AIM-DPM (Automatic Identification Manufacturers - Direct Part Marking) refers to a set of standards and guidelines for marking and reading barcodes that are directly marked on parts.
It is particularly useful in industrial environments where components need to be tracked throughout their lifecycle.
These markings are often applied via methods like laser etching, dot peening, or chemical etching, ensuring that the mark is durable and can be read throughout the component's use, even in harsh conditions.
AIM-DPM sets the standards for Direct Part Marking to ensure reliable identification and traceability of parts, even in harsh industrial environments, using permanent marking techniques like laser etching and dot peening.
Used with ProcessEngines.VisionPro only.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.BarcodeResult.ISO15415
member.summary:
ISO/IEC 15415 is an international standard that defines the quality criteria for the print quality and verification of 2D symbols, such as Data Matrix and QR codes, specifically for symbols printed or marked directly on products or packaging.
It is one of the key standards used in industries that rely on 2D barcodes for automatic identification and data capture (AIDC), such as the aerospace, automotive, healthcare, and logistics sectors.
Used with ProcessEngines.VisionPro only.
Letter grades are :
4 = A (excellent)
3 = B (good)
2 = C (acceptable)
1 = D (poor)
0 = F (fail)
ISO/IEC 15415 defines the international standard for evaluating the print quality of 2D barcodes, ensuring they meet necessary quality levels for reliable scanning.
It provides guidelines for grading and verifying the quality of 2D symbols, covering crucial parameters like contrast, modulation, and decodability. By adhering to this standard, manufacturers and organizations can ensure that their barcodes remain readable throughout the product lifecycle, improving traceability, compliance, and efficiency.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.BarcodeResult.SEMIT10
member.summary:
SEMI T10 is a standard developed by SEMI (Semiconductor Equipment and Materials International) that provides guidelines for direct marking and the use of two-dimensional (2D) Data Matrix symbols to track and identify semiconductor materials, including silicon wafers, during the manufacturing process.
The SEMI T10 standard is used extensively in the semiconductor industry to ensure traceability and efficient production management.
SEMI T10 is a critical standard in the semiconductor industry for direct marking of wafers with Data Matrix codes to ensure traceability and identification throughout the production process.
It helps improve yield management, reduce production errors, and ensure the reliable handling of semiconductor wafers by standardizing how they are marked and tracked across the supply chain.
Used with ProcessEngines.VisionPro only.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.ProcessBarcodeVP.PharmaCode
member.summary:
1D: PharmaCode
Also known as Pharmaceutical Binary Code, is a barcode standard, used in the pharmaceutical industry as a packing control system.
It is designed to be readable despite printing errors.
It can be printed in multiple colors as a check to ensure that the remainder of the packaging (which the pharmaceutical company must print to protect itself from legal liability) is correctly printed.
This barcode is also known as Laetuscode.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.ProcessBarcodeVP.I2Of5
member.summary:
1D: I2Of5
Interleaved 2 of 5 (ITF) is a continuous two-width barcode symbology encoding digits. It is used commercially on 135 film, for ITF-14 barcodes, and on cartons of some products, while the products inside are labeled with UPC or EAN.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.ProcessBarcodeVP.DataBar
member.summary: 1D: Databar

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.ProcessBarcodeVP.EANUCCComposite
member.summary: 1D: EANUCC

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.ProcessBarcodeVP.Postnet
member.summary:
1D: Postnet
POSTNET (Postal Numeric Encoding Technique) is a barcode symbology used by the United States Postal Service to assist in directing mail.
The ZIP Code or ZIP+4 code is encoded in half- and full-height bars.[1] Most often, the delivery point is added, usually being the last two digits of the address or PO box number.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.ProcessBarcodeVP.Planet
member.summary:
1D: Planet
Selling barcode readers for shops which we are distributor of Mobile Computer, Barcode printer with programs from Honeywell, Zebra, TSC ready to provide professional services.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Process.ProcessBarcodeVP.FourState
member.summary:
1D: Fourstate
Used in the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) mailstream. The IMb is also known as the USPS OneCode Solution or USPS 4-State Customer Barcode (abbreviated 4CB, 4-CB, or USPS4CB)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Inspector.IInspector.ScriptFile
member.remarks:
Old ScriptInstance would be disposed and created(or replaced) by new one.
Reference script files are "default.cs" at Config.ScriptPath.
Consider as its working within async threads.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Inspector.IInspector.ScriptInstance
member.summary: Instance for created by external script
member.remarks:
Used should be implement own .cs script file.
Script class name should be matched with ScriptInstanceName and inherited from InspectorScriptBase.
Old ScriptInstance would be disposed and created(or replaced) by new one whenever ScriptFile has re-assigned.
ScriptHelper can be used for get/set(or read/write) property values.
It can be set as null to clear(or dispose) script instance.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Vision.Script.InspectorScriptBase
member.summary:
MarkerScriptBase
Support default(or base) routines for IScript.
Used with IInspector.ScriptFile.
Every external script files are must be inherited from IScript.
Also, user scripts are should be inherited from InspectorScriptBase for easy to use.
member.remarks:
User can read(or write) property values at script by ScriptHelper.
Sample script file exist at 'bin\script\vision\default.cs'
